challenge.description: Significant capacity failure observed after high-temperature storage, particularly for shallow de-lithiated phases.
challenge.impact: The capacity failure reduces the effectiveness of the material as a cathode in lithium-ion batteries, limiting its practical application.

solution.description: Magnetic measurements and XANES were used to detect subtle structural changes and valence state shifts in Mn ions.
solution.methodology: Advanced characterization techniques such as SQUID magnetometry and Mn K-edge XANES spectroscopy were employed.
solution.effectiveness: The techniques successfully identified the structural and compositional changes, but the instability of the shallow de-lithiated phase remains a challenge.

evidence.data: Capacity decreased from 111 mAh/g to 40 mAh/g for sample 'Bb' after storage at 80°C, corresponding to phase transitions and Mn valence state changes.

context.material_properties: Shallow de-lithiated phase with composition Li0.84Mn1.98O4, prone to structural instability.
context.experimental_conditions: Stored in 1 M LiPF6 in EC:DEC (1:1) electrolyte solution at 80°C for 6 days.
context.application_relevance: The instability of the material under high-temperature storage conditions affects its viability as a cathode material in lithium-ion batteries.

challenge.description: The shallow de-lithiated phase is highly unstable and undergoes significant decomposition during high-temperature storage.
challenge.impact: Decomposition leads to phase transitions and Mn dissolution, which degrade the material's electrochemical performance.

solution.description: Characterization of the phase composition and structural changes using XRD, XANES, and ICP spectroscopy.
solution.methodology: Detailed analysis of lattice parameters, Mn valence states, and Li/Mn ratios before and after storage.
solution.effectiveness: The analysis clarified the instability mechanisms but did not provide a direct method to stabilize the phase.

evidence.data: XRD patterns showed multi-phase behavior and peak shifts; Mn dissolution was confirmed by ICP results.

context.material_properties: Shallow de-lithiated phase with a lattice parameter of 8.22 Å, prone to Mn dissolution.
context.experimental_conditions: Stored in 1 M LiPF6 in EC:DEC (1:1) electrolyte solution at 80°C for 6 days.
context.application_relevance: The instability limits the material's use in high-temperature applications for lithium-ion batteries.

challenge.description: Fully charged state exhibits Mn dissolution and structural instability during high-temperature storage.
challenge.impact: Mn dissolution reduces the material's capacity and leads to the formation of secondary phases, degrading battery performance.

solution.description: Analysis of Mn valence states and structural changes using XANES and magnetic susceptibility measurements.
solution.methodology: Characterization of Mn valence state shifts and ferromagnetic properties to understand the degradation mechanisms.
solution.effectiveness: The techniques identified the formation of secondary phases but did not prevent Mn dissolution or improve stability.

evidence.data: Capacity decreased from 121 mAh/g to 79 mAh/g for sample 'Fb'; XANES showed Mn valence state changes.

context.material_properties: Fully charged state with Mn valence close to 4+, prone to dissolution and secondary phase formation.
context.experimental_conditions: Stored in 1 M LiPF6 in EC:DEC (1:1) electrolyte solution at 80°C for 6 days.
context.application_relevance: The instability in the fully charged state affects the material's long-term performance in lithium-ion batteries.
